alert.note: Non-Weather Emergency Message. Not sent to IPAWS.

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued November 24 at 4:46PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
info.description:
The following message is transmitted in collaboration with the South Dakota Department of Agriculture and Natural Resources.
* WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected.
* WHERE...West of the Gap in Rapid City.
* WHEN...8 PM tonight through 2 PM Tuesday.
IMPACTS...The gusty winds will suspend fine dust in the air and produce poor air quality.
info.instruction:
The Rapid City Air Quality Office recommends the elderly, young, and anyone with respiratory problems avoid excessive physical exertion and exposure to the outside air.
Voluntary actions to reduce dust pollution include, ceasing or reducing the manipulation of soil in construction, industrial, and agricultural activities, and increasing the use of pollution controls for soil stabilization, waste pits, stock piles, and construction sites.

parameter.value: AIR POLLUTION ALERT FOR DUST FOR RAPID CITY WEST OF THE GAP IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM MST TUESDAY
